fields.description:
This is polluting the EAC logs and makes it hard to spot other errors.

This is a pretty simple thing to fix up and avoid the class cast exception (fetch abstract page and then do check?)

we should also provide a way to get page or blog so the end user doesn't have to try to get a page, and upon failing, try to get a blog.

fields.description:
When I try to move a page into a different location in the hierarchy, the page appears to move to the correct location, but it then moves back to where it was previously (at the bottom of the list in its parent page).

The page is located here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Team+Calendars+5.0+Release+Notes

I have the correct permissions for the page/space, and I'm able to move other pages in the space and under the same parent page.
fields.summary: Can't move a page to its correct place in the hierarchy.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38495].
  {panel}

For reasons that aren't immediately obvious, the workday plugin has a direct dependency on the quartz scheduler.

1. This is going to be a showstopper in JIRA 7.0, because the quartz scheduler isn't going to be exported by JIRA core anymore.  If it really needs scheduling, it will have to use {{atlassian-scheduler-api}} or be happy with SAL.
2. I don't understand why it has this dependency at all.  It doesn't seem to be doing anything with it, and the version it specifies in its top-level pom is 2.1.2, which isn't what either JIRA or Confluence exports.

P.S.: I couldn't find a component that seemed relevant for Workday and you wouldn't let me submit without one, so I picked BugFix Team.
fields.summary: Workday plugin has a direct dependency on quartz
When adding a new restriction, the button appears to be disabled

* A4. Master UI Selenium, Firefox 31, Documentation Theme (Java 6) [here|https://collaboration-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONFUI-SELENIUMFF36DOCUMENTATION14] (though this should be Java 8 for us)

fields.description:
Customers reported today that the UPM told them they were running an unknown, incompatible version of Confluence. As such, administrators were unable to check add-ons for compatibility or search within the UPM for new add-ons.

Upon inspection I noticed that Confluence 5.5.4 was listed in Marketplace admin, but was not published.

I have now manually corrected this problem.

Keeping the Marketplace site in sync with versions released in HAMS is an important part of the build process.  Failing to do this causes confusion and friction for customers and wastes time in raised support tickets.

This is a recurring issue, and is continuing to cause frustration for me as the person who receives these problem reports and has to solve them.

At one point in history this process was part of an automated build. Marketplace has a REST API for version management.  How is this still happening?

This is the fourth time in the last year or so that this has happened, requiring manual intervention from a Marketplace administrator to correct, and worse so, goes un-noticed until a customer or an add-on vendor reports this problem.

The way in which this is continuing to happen sporadically is a clear indicator that the current process is broken. I am interested to hear how the Confluence team intends to fix this.
fields.summary: Confluence 5.5.4 was not published to the Marketplace correctly

fields.description:
It has been decided that we'll no longer be shipping with the confluence war distributions: 

https://pug.jira.com/wiki/display/CP/Decision%3A+Stop+shipping+the+WAR+edition+after+Confluence+5.6

We need to update our release scripts such that these war distributions are no longer generated and that they are no longer available for download.
fields.summary: Stop the war editions of Confluence from being generated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38478].
  {panel}

On the header there is a create button:

- Click the create button.
- Press "Close" before the page selection area loads.
- Click the create button again.
- Page selection area never loads after this point in time. It just shows a spinner forever. A full page refresh is required for the "create" button to work again.

I have attached a screenshot of the page selection area when it is in the spinner state.

Latest Chrome on OSX.
fields.summary: On EAC, clicking the create button twice, the "page selection" area fails to load

fields.description:
- Go to https://extranet.atlassian.com/spacedirectory/view.action
- Click any of 6, 9, 10 in the pages list at the bottom
- Get error banner: "An error occurred while searching for spaces", and no spaces or page list are displayed.

This seems to be consistently reproducible for me on only those page numbers in the list. Other pages display OK. So maybe this is caused by something specific to the particular spaces displayed on those pages?
fields.summary: Error when trying to view pages 6, 9 or 10 of Site Spaces list

fields.description:
Please see the attached screenshots.

Steps to reproduce:

# Enter a search that uses '+' e.g. {{+"Innovation Week" +mtokar}}. Make sure this search returns more than one page of results
# Navigate to a subsequent page of results, either using Next or by going to a page index.

When you arrive at the next page of results, the query executed has changed. It has replaced '+' with space, so that the result set is much larger.
fields.summary: I found a bug in Confluence Search when using '+' and paginated results
Likes on this page just fail to load

fields.description:
After sharing with a group (in this case an email alias), clicking on Share, and getting the "done" status. the group remains active - if you share with a second group, you might inadvertently share again with the prior group, causing the same email to be sent twice. I almost did this for "sf@atlassian.com" and would have spammed everyone in SF ;-(

In other words the user has to explicitly delete the 1st group after successfully sharing to avoid a repeat share.
fields.summary: Issue in "Share" function

fields.description:
because Confluence search is kind of not great, I just use my browser URL bar to navigate confluence because it's a great searchable list of pages I've looked at recently.

Often I just have the docreatepage in my history, and when I go there it just says "not permitted"

It doesn't say "this page already exists, would you like to see it?"

That would be nicer huh [~htapia]?
fields.summary: is it worth the time to give people a link to the page if they try to create a page that already exists?

fields.summary: Creating a task canvas gives 404 error

fields.description:
Our database startup checks are non-existent or executed too late. We should provide a better solution to our customers as this is a huge pain point for support.

An example is issue CONFDEV-27706, this check runs after the schema has been created, (this is how most checks are done), by this time it is too late if the customer forgets to put the collation or isolation right and usually means they'll need to blow away the db and home directory.

We should either provide a check before any db insert/create statements and/or provide a 'Test Setup' button where we can do these db/driver checks.
fields.summary: Fix up db setup checks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38457].
  {panel}

Not sure how long this has been broken for, but I recall having seen this a couple of times previously and not clicking what the problem was.

When you try to move a page and browse the tree, a broken image appears next to the page that you try to expand.

Upon inspection, it appears it's trying to load: https://extranet.atlassian.com/s/en_GB/5619/5a47992db52859e06621b430f6d8201fa3911c53.80/_/images/ddtree/black%20spinner/12.png which returns Page not found.

Also appears on space tools > reorder pages.

Might be a regression from when we implemented AUI spinners.
fields.summary: Spinner missing/broken from move dialog (browse)

fields.description:
The @ character is not properly escaped in URLs on Confluence, causing problems with the file previewer amongst other things.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a page with an @ symbol in the title.
2. Save the page
3. Note that the URL is not escapes (@ should be replaced with %40), nor does it redirect to the pageid version of the URL

One weird thing to note is that if @ is at the _end_ of the title, it correctly produces a pageId URL.
fields.summary: @ character not escaping properly in URLs

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page
# In the Editor tool bar, select to Insert a Link, and choose Web Link
# Add a link and Save, e.g.:
## Address: https://www.google.com
## Link text: Google
# Highlight the link and set it to a different color using the tool bar
# Click the link and try to edit it

h2. Expected behavior
Both "Address" and "Link text" fields will show up and be configurable

h2. Actual behavior
"Address" field remains, but "Link text" field is completely missing

h2. Workarounds
If the link is returned to its original state (i.e. no custom color set) by highlighting + clicking the color chooser, it will return to the expected behavior once again.

Alternatively, you can change the link text in the editor itself by modifying the text somewhere in the middle of the string (adding text to the end of the colored link will result in the newly added text being unlinked).
fields.summary: The "Link Text" field for a Web Link is missing if the link is set to a custom color

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38340].
  {panel}

For Confluence, when we add a new video through the Drag&Drop feature (in my example, .mp4 files) it will automatically convert the video inside the Multimedia macro. However, since the macro can expect some issues [such as this bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33678], it can affect on the video display.

This Improvement Request is to allow the users to have options to disable the auto conversion from Drag&Drop to Multimedia macro or give the users options to render it as a link or only the attachment in the page. 

A suggestion to achieve it could be to insert a new module which would disable the auto preview for Drag&Drop attachments or provide an additional option in the Drag&Drop loading menu, before inserting the video in the page.

A workaround is to add the video through the *Page Editor > Insert > Files and Images*, since this will not convert to the Multimedia.
fields.summary: Option to Disable Multimedia Macro for Drag&Drop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38339].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
The documentation for [Migrating from HSQLDB to MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Migrating+from+HSQLDB+to+MySQL] instructs customers to use a tool that is no longer supported by Oracle, and the link to this tool redirects to their newer Workbench tool. The instructions that follow, if you try using Workbench don't seem to work (especially for 5.8 and above which uses the newer h2 database).

h4. Solution
Remove this page of the documentation. Customers can already migrate from HSQLDB to any supported database by following the instructions at [Migrating to Another Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+to+Another+Database].
fields.summary: Documentation for Migrating from HSQLDB to MySQL is out of date

fields.description:
If you are using the automatic numbering of steps and insert a page break so that you can keep an instruction from crossing pages or instructions with an image, the numbering starts over. 
When you view the page, the numbering is correct. But, once exported, the numbering restarts on the new page.  

I tried inserting the page break at the beginning of the instruction that starts over.  When you do that, that line's number is kept, but the next number is restarted back to one. 

This makes managing content difficult and looks unprofessional when it is client facing.  I should not have to insert multiple line breaks to force the content to the next page - that makes reading on line look odd.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38323].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As Described in:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35285 

The Section Macro increases CPU load dramatically rendering text directly in the BODY of the Section, and In Confluence Cloud after 60 seconds of load will cause a Page Timeout to occur locking all users from accessing the page.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit page Page
# Add Section Macro
# Add large body of text to the Macro outside a Column macro
# Save

h3. Expected Results
# Text rendered in body of section macro

h3. Actual Results
Page will be locked and you will receive a Page unavailable screen and the System CPU will be pegged at 100% slowing down the entire system for 60 seconds, for each page load attempt.

No errors in the logs

h3.Workaround
Detailed Workaround can be located Here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Section+Macro+causes+page+timeout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38312].
  {panel}

At present, Confluence has a feature whereby you can select some text on a page, click a JIRA icon and a Create Issue 'popover' appears. This is useful, but it is limited to creating top-level issues.

Our use case: as part of our development process, we write up proposed approaches to solve JIRA issues as pages in Confluence. Having done this, we then copy and paste the relevant sections of the text from Confluence to JIRA so we can create subtasks for each aspect as we work through the solution.

It would be great if we could do this using the Create Issue feature in Confluence, but it doesn't support subtasks.

So, the issue type menu could include subtask types, and when one is selected, an additional field could appear so the parent issue can be specified.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA subtasks to be created from Confluence

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Given that Confluence has an application link to JIRA using 2LOi authentication
And a JIRA issue is embedded in a Confluence page
And a Confluence user doesn't have permission to view the issue in JIRA
When this user views the Confluence page
Then an error is shown.

Since the error does not indicate which issue is embedded the user has no way to contact the correct JIRA project lead to request permissions for the JIRA project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the project key and issue ID in the error message.

fields.description:
The Space Admin functionality allows a space to have 'Anonymous Access' allowed and displays the following warning:

{quote}
    WARNING
    Anonymous users will not be able to view this space, because they have not been granted the global ‘Use Confluence’ permission. You can grant anonymous access to Confluence from global permissions.

When a user is using Confluence while not logged in, they are using it anonymously.
For example: Enabling anonymous 'commenting' permission, allows non-logged-in users to make comments in this space. 
{quote}

The global permissions of the Confluence environment prevents anonymous users from accessing Confluence.

However, a user that is permissioned to Confluence (has valid login account) but does not belong to a group that is currently permissioned to the space is now able to access the space. 

e.g think about the below scenario.

User has access to Space A only, but space B has been given anonymous access and global configuration is set to prevent anonymous access. 

In this case user can access Space A and space B

This is misleading and something is not correct. At least the warning in Space permission admin page.

This is same as CONF-28946, but creating this issue to highlight the same.
fields.summary: Anonymous space permission allows anyone who logged-in to access space, even when global permissions are set to prevent anonymous access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38294].
  {panel}

Customer feedback and data analysis for CONF-34326 indicates that the slowness of the Page Properties Report (PPR) can be attributed to the number of cells being rendered in the report, rather than (say) the number of pages being scanned for Page Property rows to include.

The update of the PPR in Confluence 5.8 to use CQL filtering when editing the macro parameters has alleviated the problem for some customers by reducing the number of rows, and hence the total number of cells, rendered - but other customers have use-cases where the user viewing the report needs to be able to perform the filtering themselves. Currently the only option for these cases is to render a large number of rows and let the user search for a value within the browser.

Adding the CQL filter field UI to the rendered PPR would allow _additional_ filtering (as opposed to replacing the configured filter) to be applied, reducing the need for a large row count to be specified in the report parameters.

However, if the rows would need filtering on output of the report (e.g. only show rows in an employee table where the Office value is "Sydney"), there will additional development required to get these values indexed.

Therefore, if you vote for this issue, please include a comment with the kind of filtering you would require!
fields.summary: Provide CQL filter UI in rendered Page Properties Report

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a JIRA macro in Confluence, multi select fields are displayed incorrectly.

h3. Environment
Server and possibly Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a customer multi-select field
* Populate this field with multiple items
* Add the JIRA macro to a Confluence page
* Display the custom field in the JIRA macro

h3. Expected Results

In JIRA the multi-select field separates values with a comma. The JIRA macro should do this as well.

h3. Actual Results

In JIRA the multi-select field separates values with a comma. The JIRA macro within Confluence does not do this.

h3. Notes
Screenshots attached

h3.Workaround
No current workaround is known
fields.summary: Custom field not displaying properly in JIRA Macro

fields.description:
To reproduce the problem:
# in Space 1, create a page called Page A
# in Space 2, create a page called Page A
# view the Space 2 home page
# try to move Page A in Space 1 to Space 2 by specifying the _New space_ and _New parent page_ on the *Advanced tab* in the Move dialog box
#* you see an error message warning about the duplicate page name and the move fails
# try to move Page A in Space 1 to Space 2 by selecting the Space 2 home page from the *Recently Viewed* tab in the Move dialog box
#* there is no response (no error message) and the move fails

The duplicate page name error should be shown if the destination of the move is selected using the Recently Viewed tab.
fields.summary: No error message when moving page with duplicate name using Recently Viewed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Crowd 2.7 features primary group support per [CWD-1286|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1286]. This feature is not found in Confluence 5.3 or later which has Crowd 2.7 embedded.


h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.3 or later

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up connector for Active Directory

h3. Expected Results
Expect same option in Crowd 2.7 to enable primary group support. See screenshot of Crowd 2.7 and Crowd 2.8.

h3. Actual Results
No option is found for enabling primary group support.
fields.summary: Embedded Crowd missing primary group support for Active Directory

fields.description:
When the WAS clause is used in conjunction with BEFORE, the Jira Issue Macro will not render. After the macro is configured and saved, it disappears from the page.

* The same macro with the same JQL will render properly if you select the default "as table" display option.
* Once saved that way, it cannot be changed to display the count only.
* This happens the same way whether using JQL in the gadget or referencing a saved filter.

Here is a sample JQL statement that demonstrates the issue.

{{project = "project name" and resolution was Resolved before 2015-07-01}}

Remove {{before 2015-07-01}} and the macro works as expected.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro will not display count when WAS+BEFORE used in JQL

If you embed a contributors macro in a template then hit preview, you get this error message:
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/383n3v1B1p2E360n280n/Image%202015-07-15%20at%204.06.02%20pm.png!

fields.description:
h6. Summary:
When doing migration of Confluence between servers Using XML data backups, third party plugins will not be automatically installed in the new server (However, the datas of the plugin is still retained)

h6. Problem Statement:
Customer are not aware of this behavior and is not being mentioned in the documentation:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+Confluence+Between+Servers
(update 22/9/2015) 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-site-152034.html

h6. What we would like to see
Mention in the documentation about this behavior to raise awareness to the customers who are performing the migration using the XML backup
fields.summary: Update the "Migrating Confluence Between Servers" Documentation regarding manually reinstalling previously installed plugins

fields.description:
1. Put an image in a table cell in the editor.
2. Save the page.
3. Open the page to edit again and click on the image in the cell so that it turns blue and is selecte.
4. Press the keyboard left-arrow key.
5. Hit Return key.

Expected result:  A newline is created before the image.

Actual result: A newline is created after the image.

Repeating these steps again results in the correct result.
fields.summary: Cursor placement incorrect if a table cell only contains an image
